title: Drawing, Six capitals of pillars, with alternative suggestions, 1780–1800
title_raw: Six capitals of pillars, with alternative suggestions
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and brown, gray wash, traces of graphite on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and ink, upper right corner: 109; 104
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: 1)Two dolphins, a panel with rinceaux and animal heads; 2) at left, the half figure of an eagle, at right, with head and wings of a satyr; in the center a capital over a vase-like object; 3) with a medallion containing the bust of a bearded man, framed by two half figures of eagles and fastened to their necks by a crown; 4) dragons and rinceaux; 5) with ram’s heads at the corners and in the center supporting festoons. A panel with rinceaux; 6) in the center above a lion’s mask supporting drapery festoons, the opposite ends of which are supported at left by an animal’s head, at right by the tail of a dolphin.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Six capitals of pillars, with alternative suggestions, 1780–1800. Pen and black ink, brush and brown, gray wash, traces of graphite on off-white laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4610
